29#ifndef ISCCC_CCMSG_H
30#define ISCCC_CCMSG_H 1
31
32/*! \file isccc/ccmsg.h */
33
34#include <inttypes.h>
35
36#include <isc/buffer.h>
37#include <isc/lang.h>
38#include <isc/socket.h>
39
40/*% ISCCC Message Structure */
41typedef struct isccc_ccmsg {
42 /* private (don't touch!) */
43 unsigned int magic;
44 uint32_t size;
45 isc_buffer_t buffer;
46 unsigned int maxsize;
47 isc_mem_t *mctx;
48 isc_socket_t *sock;
49 isc_task_t *task;
50 isc_taskaction_t action;
51 void *arg;
52 isc_event_t event;
53 /* public (read-only) */
54 isc_result_t result;
55 isc_sockaddr_t address;
56} isccc_ccmsg_t;
57
58ISC_LANG_BEGINDECLS
59
60void
61isccc_ccmsg_init(isc_mem_t *mctx, isc_socket_t *sock, isccc_ccmsg_t *ccmsg);
62/*%
63 * Associate a cc message state with a given memory context and
64 * TCP socket.
65 *
66 * Requires:
67 *
68 *\li "mctx" and "sock" be non-NULL and valid types.
69 *
70 *\li "sock" be a read/write TCP socket.
71 *
72 *\li "ccmsg" be non-NULL and an uninitialized or invalidated structure.
73 *
74 * Ensures:
75 *
76 *\li "ccmsg" is a valid structure.
77 */
78
79void
80isccc_ccmsg_setmaxsize(isccc_ccmsg_t *ccmsg, unsigned int maxsize);
81/*%
82 * Set the maximum packet size to "maxsize"
83 *
84 * Requires:
85 *
86 *\li "ccmsg" be valid.
87 *
88 *\li 512 <= "maxsize" <= 4294967296
89 */
90
91isc_result_t
92isccc_ccmsg_readmessage(isccc_ccmsg_t *ccmsg,
93 isc_task_t *task, isc_taskaction_t action, void *arg);
94/*%
95 * Schedule an event to be delivered when a command channel message is
96 * readable, or when an error occurs on the socket.
97 *
98 * Requires:
99 *
100 *\li "ccmsg" be valid.
101 *
102 *\li "task", "taskaction", and "arg" be valid.
103 *
104 * Returns:
105 *
106 *\li #ISC_R_SUCCESS -- no error
107 *\li Anything that the isc_socket_recv() call can return. XXXMLG
108 *
109 * Notes:
110 *
111 *\li The event delivered is a fully generic event. It will contain no
112 * actual data. The sender will be a pointer to the isccc_ccmsg_t.
113 * The result code inside that structure should be checked to see
114 * what the final result was.
115 */
116
117void
118isccc_ccmsg_cancelread(isccc_ccmsg_t *ccmsg);
119/*%
120 * Cancel a readmessage() call. The event will still be posted with a
121 * CANCELED result code.
122 *
123 * Requires:
124 *
125 *\li "ccmsg" be valid.
126 */
127
128void
129isccc_ccmsg_invalidate(isccc_ccmsg_t *ccmsg);
130/*%
131 * Clean up all allocated state, and invalidate the structure.
132 *
133 * Requires:
134 *
135 *\li "ccmsg" be valid.
136 *
137 * Ensures:
138 *
139 *\li "ccmsg" is invalidated and disassociated with all memory contexts,
140 * sockets, etc.
141 */
142
143ISC_LANG_ENDDECLS
144
145#endif /* ISCCC_CCMSG_H */
146
